alert.note: Alert for Greer; Jackson; Kiowa; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 9:36PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jackson, southwestern Kiowa, northwestern Tillman and southeastern Greer Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 936 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Roosevelt to 3 miles southwest of Warren to 7 miles south of Mangum. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Altus, Snyder, Blair, Mountain Park, Roosevelt, Martha, Headrick, Friendship, Altus Air Force Base, Tom Steed Reservoir, Duke, Warren and Hester. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
